intro: Diphyes eciliata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, white hairs, which give it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
